title.rendered: “IDF, Shin Bet, Border Police Thwart Terrorism: 34 Arrests and Weapons Seizure Across Judea, Samaria, and Jordan Valley Overnight”

content.rendered:
IDF Spokesperson:

The IDF, the Shin Bet and the Border Police operated overnight to arrest 34 wanted persons across Judea and Samaria and in the Jordan Valley and the valleys; five of them in an operation to thwart terror in the Jordan Valley and the valleys led by the Kfir Brigade under the guidance of the Shin Bet.

The Kfir Brigade led an operation overnight to prevent terror in the villages of Tamun and Tubas in the Jordan Valley and the valleys. Under the guidance of the Shin Bet, the forces detained five wanted individuals suspected of involvement in terrorist activities, located weapons, and questioned additional suspects. During the operation, terrorists threw charges at the forces, no one was injured.

Throughout the night, the IDF, Shin Bet and Border Police arrested an additional 29 wanted persons across Judea and Samaria.

In Jilazun in Binyamin, the soldiers arrested six wanted persons, and in the village of Je’bah in Eztion, the soldiers arrested two wanted persons and found weapons. In the village of Aabush in Ephraim, the forces found additional weapons.

The wanted individuals who were arrested and the confiscated weapons have been handed over for further treatment by security forces, and our forces were not injured.

So far, since the beginning of the war, about 3,450 wanted persons have been arrested all over the Judea and Samaria Division and the Jordan Valley and the valleys brigade, around 1,500 of them affiliated with the Hamas terrorist organization.

Attached is documentation of the force’s activities: https://bit.ly/3TmcDHz

Attached are related photos: https://IDFANC.activetrail.biz/ANC07032024.1561598
